intro: Mesembryanthemum familiare, commonly known as the common ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, pink, and white. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a shallow root system that allows it to absorb moisture quickly from infrequent rains. It is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
